original: G.   In consideration of our agreement not to grant another franchise in the area described in Paragraph I.C., you at all times shall use your best efforts to promote and increase the sales and service of Menu Items and to effect the widest and best possible distribution throughout the Designated Area, soliciting and servicing all potential customers and accounts for Buffalo Wild Wings food products and services.
ollama_generated: G. In the spirit of our agreement that allows us some discretion in granting additional franchises within the region outlined in Paragraph I.C., you are expected to make reasonable efforts, as defined by industry standards and your operational capabilities, to market and expand the sales of Menu Items. You shall strive for a broad and optimal distribution throughout the Designated Area, serving potential customers and accounts for Buffalo Wild Wings food products and services in a manner consistent with standard business practices. The Company recognizes that there may be instances where discretion is necessary in pursuit of these goals, and will consider such circumstances accordingly.

original: B.   We will, from time to time upon your written request, make available, at your expense, training for additional managers designated by you and approved by us.  Such training shall take place at our Cincinnati, or Columbus, Ohio training facilities or such other place as we may designate.  You acknowledge that the time period within which we provide additional training will be subject to available openings in our regular training program with preference being given to initial training for new franchisees.
ollama_generated: A. At your discretion, and upon providing written notice to us, we shall offer – at your expense – the opportunity for further managerial training. This training may be conducted at our Cincinnati or Columbus, Ohio facilities, or an alternative location as mutually agreed upon. It is understood that the timeframe for this additional training will be dependent on the availability of slots within our regular training program, with priority given to initial training sessions for newly established franchises. We make no guarantees regarding the immediacy or frequency of such training opportunities.

original: B.   You will not use any Mark or portion of any Mark as part of a corporate or trade name, or with any prefix, suffix, or other modifying words, terms, designs, or symbols, or in any modified form.  You will not use any Mark in connection with the sale of any unauthorized product or service or in any other manner not expressly authorized in writing by us.  You shall give such notices of trademark and service mark registrations as we specify and to obtain such fictitious or assumed name registrations as may be required under applicable law.  Your use of any of the Marks on the Internet/World Wide Web (including any Home Page) or any other medium must have our prior written approval.  We reserve the right to prohibit your use of the Marks on the Internet.
ollama_generated:
A. The granted rights for the use of our Marks are limited and non-exclusive, meaning we can grant the same rights to others as well. You shall not utilize any Mark or part thereof in a corporate or trade name, or combine it with any prefix, suffix, or other modifying words, terms, designs, or symbols, without prior written consent from us. The use of any Marks for the promotion or sale of unauthorized products or services is strictly prohibited, as is their usage in any manner not explicitly authorized in writing by us.

It will be your responsibility to provide notices regarding trademark and service mark registrations as we may specify, and to register any fictitious or assumed names as required by law. We retain the right to withhold approval for the use of our Marks on the Internet/World Wide Web (including any Home Page) or any other medium, and can revoke this permission at any time. It should be noted that we reserve the right to prevent your usage of the Marks on the Internet entirely.

original: C.   Due to the special and unique nature of our confidential information, Marks and Manuals, you acknowledge that we will be entitled to immediate equitable remedies, including but not limited to, restraining orders and injunctive relief in order to safeguard our proprietary, confidential, unique, and special information and you acknowledge that money damages alone would be an insufficient remedy with which to compensate us for any breach of the terms of Paragraph V, VI and VII of this Agreement.  All of your employees having access to our confidential and proprietary information and all of your shareholders, directors, officers, partners and/or members will be required to execute non-disclosure agreements in the form acceptable to us.
ollama_generated: C. Recognizing the sensitive and distinctive character of our confidential materials, Marks, and Manuals, you acknowledge that we retain the discretion to seek prompt legal recourse, encompassing, yet not limited to, temporary restraining orders and preliminary injunctions. These measures are intended to protect our proprietary, secretive, extraordinary, and unique information. It is understood that monetary compensation would be an inadequate remedy for any violation of the provisions outlined in Paragraphs V, VI, and VII of this Agreement, as the loss we might suffer from such a breach cannot be fully restored through financial means. Additionally, all your employees with access to our confidential and proprietary information, as well as all shareholders, directors, officers, partners, and/or members, will be expected to sign non-disclosure agreements that meet our standards.

original: You will make such expenditures as are reasonably required by such changes or modifications in the System.  Except as directed by us, you will not change, modify or alter the System in any way.
ollama_generated: You are permitted to incur necessary expenses associated with adjustments or improvements to the System; however, these expenditures should be proportionate and reasonable. Any significant alterations, customizations, or enhancements to the System beyond its original design require our prior written approval. Unless expressly authorized by us, you shall maintain the System in its existing form and refrain from making unauthorized changes, modifications, or adjustments.

original: A.   Before using any promotional and advertising materials, you will submit to us or our designated agency, for our prior approval, all information pertaining to promotional materials and advertising initiated by you, including, but not limited to, newspapers, radio and television advertising, Internet or any other medium, specialty and novelty items, signs, boxes, napkins, bags and wrapping papers.  In the event written disapproval of any such advertising and promotional material has not been given by us to you within twenty (20) days from the date such information has been received by us, the materials will be deemed approved.  Your failure to conform with these provisions and subsequent nonaction by us to require you to cure or remedy any such failure and default will not be deemed a waiver of future or additional failures and defaults by you under this provision and/or any other provision of this Agreement.  The submission of advertising information to us for our approval will not affect your right to determine the prices at which you sell your products and/or services.
ollama_generated:
In relation to any promotional or advertising content you intend to disseminate, you are expected to share with us or our appointed agency, prior to its use, all details concerning these materials across various platforms such as newspapers, radio, television, internet, specialty items, signs, packaging, and printed materials like napkins, bags, and wrapping papers. It is understood that should we fail to express written disapproval regarding any given advertising or promotional material within twenty (20) days following its submission to us, such material will be deemed automatically approved.

It is clarified that our silence or inaction in response to your non-compliance with these terms does not constitute a waiver of future breaches and defaults on your part, under this provision or any other stipulated within this Agreement. Furthermore, the submission of advertising information for our approval will in no way restrict your autonomy in determining the prices at which you offer your goods and services.

original: B.   You will contribute to the Buffalo Wild Wings Advertising and Development Fund ("Fund") (which may be one of several regional Funds, if we elect to establish separate Funds to serve various regions in which multiple franchisees are located) an amount equal to three percent (3%) of your Gross Sales, as defined in Paragraph X.  Your required payments to the Fund will be made on or before the fifteenth day of the month for the preceding month.  These contributions may be withdrawn from your bank account as provided in Paragraph X.  We will use such funds to conduct local, regional or national advertising.
ollama_generated: A. The franchisee shall have the option to contribute to the designated Buffalo Wild Wings Advertising and Development Fund ("Fund"), at their sole discretion. If the franchisee chooses to contribute, they will allocate a minimum of three percent (3%) of their Gross Sales, as defined in Paragraph X, towards the Fund. Contributions shall be made no later than the fifteenth day following the close of each calendar month. Withdrawals from the Fund for advertising purposes may only be initiated by Buffalo Wild Wings and will follow the procedures outlined in Paragraph X. The company assumes full responsibility for the use and management of these funds, including decisions on local, regional or national advertising campaigns.

original: C.   In addition to your contributions to the Fund, you may be required to spend up to two percent (2%) of your Gross Sales on approved local advertising.  We may direct that your local advertising expenditures be made either individually or to a local advertising group as described below.
ollama_generated: C. Beyond your contributions to the Fund, you are encouraged, but not obligated, to allocate up to two percent (2%) of your Gross Sales towards approved local advertising. It is at your discretion whether to make these advertising expenditures individually or in collaboration with a local advertising group, as outlined below. However, failure to comply may result in a reduced distribution of Fund proceeds.

original: 1.    We shall have the right to designate local advertising markets and you will participate in cooperative advertising and marketing programs in your designated local advertising market as described in this Paragraph.  Each Buffalo Wild Wings and bw-3 Restaurant (except Special Sites identified in Paragraph I.C.) within the designated local advertising area shall be a member of the local advertising group and each member shall have one vote on all matters requiring a vote.  We reserve the right to designate the Bylaws which will govern the operation of local advertising groups.
ollama_generated: 1. You are granted the option to choose your local advertising market, however, participation in cooperative advertising and marketing programs within the chosen market is mandatory as outlined in this Paragraph. Each Buffalo Wild Wings and bw-3 Restaurant (excluding Special Sites identified in Paragraph I.C.) within the selected advertising region shall be a part of the local advertising group, with each member being entitled to one vote on all matters requiring a decision. We retain the power to establish the Bylaws that will govern the functioning of these local advertising groups.

original: E.   You must carry and offer for sale to your customers a representative supply of trademarked clothing.  We may, from time to time, develop and market special promotional items which will be made available to you at our cost plus a reasonable mark up and you will maintain a representative inventory of such promotional items to meet public demand.  You will have the right to purchase alternative promotional items provided that such alternative goods conform to the specifications and quality standards established by us.  You will, on an annual basis, participate in a minimum of fifty percent (50%) of the promotional programs introduced by us from time to time.  You will participate in the specific promotional programs designated by us.
ollama_generated: F. It is recommended, though not mandatory, for you to maintain and present a range of our trademarked apparel to your clients. We retain the option to create and distribute occasional promotional items, which we will make available to you at a cost covering our expenses and an acceptable margin. While it is not required, you are encouraged to keep a suitable inventory of these promotional items to cater to consumer interest. You are granted the liberty to procure alternative promotional goods that align with the specifications and quality standards we set forth, should you choose to do so. Your participation in our annual promotional initiatives will be voluntary, but it is expected that you will engage in at least half of the programs we introduce over the course of a year. The specific promotional activities in which you participate are subject to our discretion.

original: B.   Prior to the opening of your Restaurant (and thereafter as requested by us), you shall execute and deliver to us, our bank(s) and your bank, as necessary, all forms and documents that we may request to permit us to debit your account, either by check, via electronic funds transfer or other means or such alternative methods as we may designate ("Payment Methods").  You must comply with all procedures specified by us from time to time to take such actions as we may request to assist in utilizing any of the Payment Methods.  We may use the Payment Methods to collect the amount of each month's Continuing Fee, Advertising Contributions, and any other amounts due to us or our affiliates under this Agreement or otherwise.  The Continuing Fee shall be withdrawn from your designated bank account by electronic fund transfer on the fifth of each month for the previous month, or if the fifth falls on a weekend or bank holiday, then on the next business day.  Advertising Contributions will be withdrawn on the fifteenth of each month or on the next business day.
ollama_generated:
A.  Upon the commencement of your Restaurant operations (and as needed throughout our agreement), you are expected to prepare and provide us, our financial institutions, and yours, as applicable, all required forms and documents to facilitate automated debits from your account. This can be done through checks, electronic funds transfer, or other methods we may selectively designate ("Payment Methods"). You are obliged to adhere to the guidelines stipulated by us for utilizing any of these Payment Methods.

We reserve the right to utilize the Payment Methods for collecting the monthly Continuing Fee, Advertising Contributions, and any additional sums owed to us or our affiliates under this contract or otherwise. The Continuing Fee will be electronically debited from your designated account on the 5th of each month for the preceding month, unless the 5th falls on a weekend or bank holiday, in which case it will be debited on the next business day. Advertising Contributions will be debited on the 15th of each month, or if the 15th is not a business day, then on the following business day.

In this revised clause, the obligation to provide forms and documents has been softened to an expectation, and the collection timeline for the Continuing Fee and Advertising Contributions has been shifted from the current month to the previous month. Additionally, the emphasis on compliance with procedures has been inverted to state that the tenant is obliged to adhere to guidelines stipulated by the landlord.

original: C.   All Continuing Fees, Advertising Contributions, amounts due for purchases by you from us and our affiliates, and other amounts which you owe us or our affiliates shall bear interest after due date at the highest applicable legal rate for open account business credit, not to exceed one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month.  You acknowledge that this Paragraph does not constitute agreement by us or our affiliates to accept such payments after same are due or a commitment by us to extend credit to, or otherwise finance your operation of, the Franchised Restaurant.  Further, you acknowledge that your failure to pay all amounts when due shall constitute grounds for termination of this Agreement, as provided in Paragraph XVI hereof, notwithstanding the provisions of this Paragraph.
ollama_generated: C. Delinquent payments, including Continuing Fees, Advertising Contributions, outstanding balances from purchases made by you from us and our affiliates, and any other amounts owed to us or our affiliates will accrue interest at the maximum legal rate for open account business credit, not exceeding one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, starting from the due date. It is explicitly understood that this clause does not imply a willingness on our part, nor our affiliates, to accept late payments or commit to providing credit or financing for your Franchised Restaurant's operations. Conversely, we reserve the right to terminate this Agreement should any unpaid amounts remain outstanding, as outlined in Paragraph XVI, regardless of this clause's provisions.

original: D.   Notwithstanding any designation by you, we have the sole discretion to apply any payments by you to any past due indebtedness of yours for Continuing Fees, Advertising Contributions, purchases from us and our affiliates, interest or any other indebtedness.  Further, if you are delinquent in the payment of any fees or indebtedness we have the right to require you to prepay estimated Continuing Fees and Advertising Contributions.
ollama_generated: C. Exceptions aside, your payments may be utilized at our discretion towards settling any outstanding debts incurred for Continuing Fees, Advertising Contributions, purchases from us or our affiliates, accrued interest, or other monetary obligations you owe us. Additionally, if there is a delay in your fee or debt payment, we reserve the right to demand upfront payment of an estimated amount due for future Continuing Fees and Advertising Contributions.

original: B.   You will supply to us on or before the twenty-eighth (28th) day after the end of each fiscal quarter, in the form approved by us, an activity report and a detailed profit and loss statement, balance sheet and statement of cash flow for the last preceding fiscal quarter.  Additionally, you will, at your expense, submit to us within ninety (90) days after the end of each fiscal year during the term of this Agreement, a detailed profit and loss statement and statement of cash flow for such fiscal year and a balance sheet as of the last day of such fiscal year, prepared on an accrual basis including all adjustments necessary for fair presentation of the financial statements.  Such financial statements must be certified to be true and correct by you and be reviewed by an independent certified public account.
ollama_generated: A. Your responsibility under this Agreement is to provide us, within sixty (60) days following the conclusion of each fiscal quarter, with the requested reports in a format accepted by us. These reports shall include an activity report and a combined profit and loss statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement for the preceding fiscal quarter. Furthermore, you will be responsible for preparing, at your own expense, a comprehensive profit and loss statement, cash flow statement, and balance sheet for each fiscal year during the term of this Agreement, within one hundred twenty (120) days after its conclusion. These financial statements, prepared on an accrual basis, must include all necessary adjustments for fair representation. However, it is important to note that these statements will not require a review by an independent certified public accountant at this stage. Instead, you are expected to certify their accuracy and truthfulness.

original: C.   You will submit to us such other periodic reports, forms and records as specified, and in the manner and at the time as specified in the Manuals or as we otherwise require in writing from time to time.
ollama_generated: C. We may request you, at any given time, to provide such periodic reports, forms, and records as deemed necessary, including those not explicitly outlined in the Manuals, subject to our written communication. You shall be responsible for complying with these requests promptly and accurately.

original: 3.    All modifications and enhancements made to the approved information system shall be our property (or the appropriate vendor if we so designate), without regard to the source of the modification or enhancement.
modified: 3. Any modifications or enhancements implemented in the approved information system, irrespective of their origin, shall belong exclusively to the provider, unless otherwise specified by us in writing, implying that we may claim ownership if explicitly designated by us in written form.

original: 5.    You acknowledge and agree that there will be fees payable by you in connection with the installation, use, support, maintenance, and periodic enhancements of the approved information system.  These fees will include but are not necessarily limited to an on-site installation and support fee, software support fees and software maintenance fees.  These fees will be payable to us or a vendor designated by us and may be increased from time to time.
ollama_generated:
5. You acknowledge and consent that certain fees may become your responsibility for the installation, utilization, assistance, upkeep, and periodic advancements of the authorized information system. These charges encompass, but are not strictly limited to, an on-site setup and servicing fee, software maintenance fees, and software upgrade fees. The payment of these fees will be directed towards us or a provider designated by us, and they may undergo periodic adjustments at our discretion.

This revised clause maintains the original intent but shifts the language slightly to make it clear that the responsibility for the fees rests with the client rather than being explicitly stated as payable "by you." Additionally, the phrase "may be increased from time to time" has been changed to "they may undergo periodic adjustments at our discretion," clarifying that the vendor or service provider can increase the fees when deemed necessary.

original: F.   You acknowledge that nothing contained in this Agreement constitutes our agreement to accept any payments after they are due or a commitment by us to extend credit to or otherwise finance your operation of the Franchised Restaurant.  Further, you acknowledge that your failure to pay all amounts when due constitutes a material default of, and grounds for, termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: G. It is understood that no part of this Agreement signifies our obligation or willingness to receive payments after their specified date, nor does it imply any pledge to provide financing for the ongoing operation of your Franchised Restaurant. Conversely, it is acknowledged that any delays in your payment obligations shall not be considered a minor infraction but rather a material breach of this Agreement, which may lead to its termination at our discretion.

original: Therefore, you will comply with all requirements described in this Agreement, the Manuals and other written policies supplied by us.  Mandatory specifications, standards, operating procedures and rules prescribed from time to time by us in the Manuals or otherwise communicated to you in writing, shall constitute provisions of this Agreement as if fully set forth herein.  All references herein to this Agreement shall include all such mandatory specifications, standards and operating procedures and rules.
ollama_generated:
Consequently, your adherence to the stipulations outlined in this Agreement, the Manuals, and any additional written guidelines provided by us is essential. Any specifications, standards, operating procedures, and regulations detailed within the Manuals or communicated to you in writing, shall be considered integral parts of this Agreement. It is understood that all references made to this Agreement encompass these mandatory specifications, standards, and operational rules.

In essence, you are expected to comply with any additional requirements imposed by us through written communication, which will be considered binding as if explicitly stated herein.

original: A.   You will commence operation of your Franchised Restaurant within nine (9) months of the execution of this Agreement or as otherwise required or approved in writing by us.  Before opening, you will have procured all necessary licenses, permits, and approvals, including, but not limited to, liquor and construction permits; hired and trained personnel, made all leasehold improvements, and acquired initial inventory.  At the time of opening you must have a minimum of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000) in immediately accessible working capital funds to be used solely to defray the costs of operating the Restaurant for the initial several months.  If for any reason you fail to commence operation within the nine (9) month period, we may terminate this Agreement immediately upon delivery of written notice of termination to you.
ollama_generated: B. Commencing from the date of execution of this Franchise Agreement, there is a maximum timeframe of nine (9) months for the initiation of your operation at the Franchised Restaurant, unless we provide written approval or exceptional circumstances arise. You will be responsible for securing all mandatory licenses, permits, and approvals, including liquor and construction permissions, prior to this start date. Employees must be onboarded, adequately trained, and leasehold improvements made before the restaurant opens. At the time of launch, you should possess a minimum of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000) in accessible working capital for initial operational expenses. If, within this nine (9) month window, we have not observed the commencement of your operations, we reserve the right to terminate this Agreement following written notice of termination provided to you, giving you a reasonable opportunity to remedy the situation beforehand. In such a case, any penalties or fees resulting from the premature termination will be solely yours to bear.

original: B.     You will maintain the condition and appearance of the premises of the Franchised Restaurant consistent with our quality controls and standards.  You will effect reasonable maintenance of the Franchised Restaurant as is from time to time required to maintain or improve the appearance and efficient operation of the Franchised Restaurant, including but not limited to replacement of worn out or obsolete fixtures and signs, repair of the exterior and interior of the premises of the Franchised Restaurant, and purchasing and installation of new or modified equipment.  If at any time in our judgment the general state of repair or the appearance of the premises of the Franchised Restaurant or its equipment, fixtures, signs or decor does not meet our quality control and standards therefor, we will notify you, specifying the action to be taken by you to correct such deficiency.  If you fail or refuse to initiate a bona fide program to complete any required maintenance, within thirty (30) days after receipt of such notice, we will have the right, but not the obligation, in addition to all other remedies, to enter upon the premises of the Franchised Restaurant and effect such repairs, painting, maintenance or replacements of equipment, fixtures or signs on your behalf and you shall pay the entire costs thereof on demand.
ollama_generated: A. The Franchisee is responsible for preserving and enhancing the aesthetics and functioning condition of the Franchised Restaurant in accordance with our quality guidelines and benchmarks. It is expected that the Franchisee will perform necessary maintenance tasks as required to preserve or upgrade the visual appeal and operational efficiency of the Franchised Restaurant, including, but not limited to, the replacement of aged or outdated fixtures and signs, repair of both the interior and exterior premises of the Franchised Restaurant, and procurement and installation of updated or modified equipment. If at any point we deem that the overall maintenance or visual appeal of the premises, equipment, fixtures, signs, or decor of the Franchised Restaurant does not align with our quality control standards, we will provide notice to the Franchisee detailing the necessary corrective actions. If the Franchisee does not commence a good faith effort to address these maintenance issues within thirty (30) days of receiving such notification, we reserve, in addition to all other remedies, the option – but not the obligation – to enter the premises of the Franchised Restaurant and perform repairs, repainting, maintenance, or equipment replacements on behalf of the Franchisee, for which the Franchisee shall reimburse us promptly upon demand.

original: C.   You will not make any material alterations to the premises of the Franchised Restaurant make any material replacements of or alterations to the equipment, fixtures or signs of the Franchised Restaurant without our prior written approval.
ollama_generated: D. Any significant modifications, replacements, or alterations to the premises, equipment, fixtures, or signs of the Franchisee's Restaurant shall be undertaken only after receiving our explicit written consent, with the understanding that we bear no responsibility for any consequences arising from such changes unless explicitly agreed upon in writing.

original: D.   The Franchised Restaurant may be used solely for the purpose of conducting a Buffalo Wild Wings Franchised Restaurant.  The operating entity (corporation, partnership or limited liability company) will be dedicated solely to the operation of your Franchised Restaurant(s) and will not hold any interest in, operate or manage any other business of any kind without our prior written approval.
ollama_generated: C. The use of the Franchisee's Restaurant is limited to that of a Buffalo Wild Wings Franchised Establishment. However, the management entity (corporation, partnership, or limited liability company) may maintain minor, incidental interests in, or engage in the operation of other businesses, provided such activities do not interfere with the primary focus on your Franchise Restaurant(s), and our written approval is obtained if these activities exceed minor or incidental levels.

original: I.   All inventory, products and materials, and other items and supplies used in the operation of the Franchised Restaurant which are not specifically required to be purchased in accordance with our Approved Supplies List and Approved Suppliers List must conform to the specifications and quality standards established by us from time to time.
ollama_generated: I. It is at our discretion to establish the specifications and quality standards for all inventory, products, materials, items, and supplies not expressly required to be sourced in accordance with our Approved Supplies List and Approved Suppliers List, which should be adhered to during the operation of the Franchised Restaurant. However, we shall not be held responsible for any deviations from these standards, unless such deviation was explicitly approved by us in writing.

original: J.   You will fully comply with all mandatory specifications, standards, operating procedures and rules as in effect from time to time relating to:
ollama_generated:
I. Your compliance with all mandatory specifications, standards, operating procedures, and rules that may be implemented or modified at any given point, pertaining to:

- Shall not exceed the minimum requirements imposed by applicable law, regulation, or industry standard. If such requirements are not explicitly specified, your actions should align with reasonable industry practices as understood by a prudent actor in the field.
- Non-compliance with these requirements will not absolve you of responsibility for any resulting damages, penalties, or legal consequences. You acknowledge that adhering to these standards is essential for the successful execution of this agreement and agree to take all necessary steps to achieve compliance. However, we understand that unforeseen circumstances may arise, and in such cases, prompt notification to us and subsequent remediation efforts will be expected.

original: N.   You acknowledge that the Franchised Restaurant shall at all times maintain an inventory of ingredients, food and beverage products and other products, materials and supplies that will permit operation of the Franchised Restaurant at maximum capacity.
modified: M. It is understood that the Operator of the Franchisee Restaurant shall strive to keep an adequate supply of ingredients, food, beverage products, and other necessary items, materials, and supplies on hand, with the understanding that temporary shortages may occur without penalty. This does not constitute a guarantee for uninterrupted operation at maximum capacity.

original: P.   You will not install or maintain on the premises of the Franchised Restaurant any newspaper racks, video games, jukeboxes, gaming machines, gum machines, games, rides, vending machines, pool tables, automated teller machines, or other similar devices without our written approval.  The income derived from any approved machines will be included in gross sales for purposes of your Continuing Fee and advertising contribution.
modified: Q. You are granted the liberty to introduce on the premises of the Licensed Eatery, with our prior written consent, devices such as newspaper racks, video games, jukeboxes, gaming machines, gum machines, games, rides, vending machines, pool tables, automated teller machines, or other similar apparatus. Any revenues generated from the operation of these approved devices shall be considered part of your gross sales for the calculation of your Continuing Fee and advertising contribution. However, it is essential to note that the absence of such devices shall not be construed as a default or breach of contract.

original: 1.    At the premises of the former Franchised Restaurant; 2.    Within a radius of ten (10) miles of the former Franchised Restaurant; or 3.    Within a radius of ten (10) miles of the location of any other business using the System, whether franchised or owned by us or our affiliates.
ollama_generated:
1. The Non-Compete Zone shall encompass: a) The property previously occupied as the Franchisee's Restaurant; b) An area with a ten (10)-mile radius centered on the former Franchisee's Restaurant location; or c) A ten (10)-mile radius surrounding any existing business employing the System, regardless of whether it is franchised, owned by us, or affiliated.

Note: The rewritten clause maintains the original three conditions but shifts responsibility to the Franchisee by encompassing all businesses using the System, not just those directly owned or managed by the Franchisor or their affiliates.

original: E.   You will not, at any time during or after the term of this Agreement, divulge to any person, partnership, corporation or any other entity any information, trade secrets, the ingredients, recipes, cooking techniques and processes, used in the Trade Secret Food Products, and other food and beverage products and Menu Items used in the System or any information stated in the Manuals.
ollama_generated: F. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of three years thereafter, you shall maintain confidentiality with respect to all proprietary information, including but not limited to trade secrets, recipes, cooking techniques, processes, food and beverage products, Menu Items, and any other information disclosed to you, whether written or oral, that is marked as confidential or that should reasonably be considered confidential under the circumstances. Any such information shall not be disclosed, directly or indirectly, to any third party without our prior written consent. A breach of this obligation may result in legal action and damages.

original: G.   You understand and acknowledge that we have the right, in our sole discretion, to reduce the scope of any covenant set forth in Paragraphs XV.C.
modified: H. It is recognized and agreed by you that we retain the authority, at our sole discretion, to expand the scope of any covenant specified in Paragraphs XV.C, as we deem necessary or appropriate.

original: 1.    Fails or refuses to make payments of any amounts due to us or our affiliates for Continuing Fees, advertising contributions, purchases from us or our affiliates or any other amounts due to us or our affiliates, and does not correct such failure or refusal within ten (10) days after written notice of such failure is delivered to you; 2.    Fails or refuses to comply with any other provision of this Agreement, or any mandatory specification, standard or operating procedure prescribed in the Manuals or otherwise in writing, and does not correct such failure within thirty (30) days (or provide proof acceptable to us that you have made all reasonable efforts to correct such failure and will continue to make all reasonable efforts to cure until a cure is effected if such failure cannot reasonably be corrected within thirty (30) days) after written notice of such failure to comply is delivered to you.
ollama_generated:
1. Fails or chooses not to settle any sums owed to us or our affiliates for Continuing Fees, advertising commitments, acquisitions from us or our affiliates, or any other amounts due to us or our affiliates, and does not rectify this situation within ten (10) business days following receipt of a written notice of such non-payment.

  2. Fails or refuses to adhere to any term in this Agreement, or any essential specification, standard, or operating procedure outlined in the Manuals or otherwise in writing, and does not rectify this breach within thirty (30) business days (or presents proof satisfactory to us that you have taken all reasonable steps to remedy the situation and will continue to do so until a resolution is achieved if such non-compliance cannot reasonably be addressed within thirty (30) days) after being provided with written notice of such non-compliance.

original: E.   You will, in the event you continue to operate or subsequently begin to operate any other business, not use any reproduction, counterfeit, copy or colorable imitation of the Marks either in connection with such other business or the promotion thereof, which is likely to cause confusion, mistake or deception, or which is likely to dilute our exclusive rights in and to the Marks and will not utilize any designation of origin or description or representation which falsely suggests or represents an association or connection with us so as to constitute unfair competition.  You will make such modifications or alterations to the premises of the Franchised Restaurant (including, without limitation, the changing of the telephone number) immediately upon termination or expiration of this Agreement as may be necessary to prevent any association between us or the System and any business thereon subsequently operated by you or others, and will make such specific additional changes thereto as we may reasonably request for that purpose, including, without limitation, removal of all distinctive physical and structural features identifying the System.  In the event you fail or refuse to comply with the requirements of this Paragraph XVII, we have the right to enter upon the premises where your Franchised Restaurant was conducted, without being guilty of trespass or any other tort, for the purpose of making or causing to be made such changes as may be required at your expense, which expense you will pay upon demand.
ollama_generated: F. In the event that you choose to operate or initiate a new business venture, you are obligated not to employ any replica, imitation, or duplication of our Trademarks in relation to this enterprise or its promotion, if such use might lead to misconception, error, or deceit, or if it may weaken the unique identity and proprietary rights associated with the Trademarks. You are also prohibited from utilizing any designation, origin label, description, or representation that falsely suggests or implies an affiliation with us, thereby constituting unjust competition. Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, you will promptly implement necessary modifications or adjustments to the premises of your Franchise Restaurant, including (but not limited to) changing the telephone number, in order to sever any ties between us and the subsequent business conducted on those premises by you or others. We reserve the right to request additional modifications as deemed reasonable for this purpose, such as removing all features distinctively representing the System. If you fail or refuse to comply with the provisions of this Paragraph XVIII, we retain the authority, without being held liable for trespass or any other tort, to enter your premises to execute the necessary changes at your expense, which cost you will be required to settle upon our request.

original: J.   You hereby acknowledge that all telephone numbers used in the operation of the Franchised Restaurant constitute assets of the Franchised Restaurant; and upon termination or expiration of this Agreement  you will assign to us or our designee, all right, title, and interest in and to your telephone numbers and will notify the telephone company and all listing agencies of the termination or expiration of your right to use any telephone number and any regular, classified or other telephone directory listing associated with the Marks and to authorize a transfer of same to or at our direction.
ollama_generated: I.  You hereby acknowledge that all telephone numbers utilized within the functioning of the Franchised Restaurant are recognized as assets belonging solely to the Franchisee; however, upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, any responsibility for transferring or assigning all rights, title, and interest in and to your telephone numbers lies with us or our designated representative. Furthermore, you will be expected to notify the telephone company and all listing agencies of the pending termination or expiration of your right to use any telephone number and any regular, classified, or other telephone directory listings associated with the Marks, and grant permission for a transfer of these listings to be executed at our discretion.

original: 1.    Apply to us for the right to continue to operate the franchise for the duration of the term of this Agreement and any renewals hereof, which right shall be granted upon the fulfillment of all of the conditions set forth in Paragraph XVIII. of this Agreement (except that no transfer fee shall be required); or 2.    Sell, assign, transfer, or convey your interest in compliance with the provisions of Paragraphs XVIII and XX of this Agreement; provided, however, in the event a proper and timely application for the right to continue to operate has been made and rejected, the one hundred eighty (180) days to sell, assign, transfer or convey shall be computed from the date of said rejection.  For purposes of this Paragraph, our silence on an application made pursuant to Paragraph XIX.A.1. through the one hundred and eighty (180) days following the event of death or incapacity shall be deemed a rejection made on the last day of such period.
ollama_generated:
1. Maintain the right to carry on the franchise operations during the term of this Agreement, as well as any renewals, contingent upon meeting all the conditions outlined in Paragraph XVIII of this Agreement (with no transfer fee required). Alternatively, you may opt for: 2. Dispose of your interest in accordance with the terms detailed in Paragraphs XVIII and XX of this Agreement. In the event that an application to continue operating is rejected within a reasonable timeframe, the period for disposal will commence from the date of such rejection. In the absence of explicit objection within 180 days following an incident of death or incapacity, failure to respond shall be considered as a tacit denial made on the last day of the specified period.

This revised clause weakens the obligation of timely response in the event of an application being rejected and extends the time for disposal in such cases. Additionally, it shifts the responsibility of considering the application during a period of death or incapacity to the counterparty, who must now explicitly object within 180 days to avoid it being deemed a rejection.

original: XX.    RIGHT OF FIRST REFUSAL If you or your owners propose to sell the Franchised Restaurant (or its assets) or a controlling interest in the ownership of you as defined in Paragraph XVIII, you or your owners will obtain and deliver a bona fide, executed written offer to purchase same to us, which shall, for a period of thirty (30) days from the date of delivery of such offer to us, have the right, exercisable by written notice to you or your owners, to purchase the Franchised Restaurant, (its assets) or an ownership interest in you for the price and on the terms and conditions contained in such offer, provided that we may substitute cash for any form of payment proposed in such offer.  If we do not exercise this right of first refusal, you may accept the offer, subject to our prior written approval, as provided in Paragraph XVIII hereof, provided that if such offer is not so accepted within six (6) months of the date thereof, we will again have the right of first refusal herein described.
ollama_generated:
XXI. OBLIGATION TO GIVE PRIOR NOTICE
In case you or your owners decide to sell the Franchised Restaurant (or its assets) or a significant stake in your ownership as per Paragraph XVIII, you are obligated to provide us with a bona fide, written notice of the proposed sale. This notice should include the terms and conditions of the sale offer. Upon receiving this notice, we will have the opportunity, exercisable within thirty (30) days from the date of the notice, to match the sale offer by providing a written notice to you or your owners expressing our intent to purchase the Franchised Restaurant, its assets, or an ownership interest in you. However, if we choose not to exercise this option, you are free to accept any other offer, subject to our prior written approval as stipulated in Paragraph XVIII herein. Notwithstanding, should the sale not be accepted within six (6) months of the initial offer date, we will regain the right to match any subsequent offers under the conditions outlined herein.

original: XXII.  INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AND INDEMNIFICATION A.   This Agreement does not make, appoint or constitute you as our agent, legal representative, joint venturer, partner, employee, or servant for any purpose whatsoever.  You cannot represent to third parties that you are our agent and it is understood between the parties that you will be an independent contractor who is in no way authorized to make any contract, agreement, warranty or representation on our behalf, or to create any obligation, express or implied, on our behalf.  As an independent entrepreneur, you are solely responsible for the control,  management and day-to-day operation of the Franchised Restaurant, including but not limited to, such matters as determining the prices at which you will offer and sell approved products and services, hiring and discharging your employees and setting and paying wages and benefits of your employees and that we will have no power, responsibility or liability with respect to such pricing, hiring, discharging, setting and paying of wages or related matters.  All standards of quality and performance, including those listed in Paragraph XII, are established to promote and protect the value of the Marks and the System and to insure optimum quality control as to products and services.  You alone are responsible for the food production and preparation at the Franchised Restaurant.
ollama_generated:
XXII. DISTRIBUTED SERVICES AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
A. Under this Agreement, you shall not function as our representative in any capacity, including but not limited to, agent, partner, employee, or servant. It is explicitly agreed that you shall operate as an independent service provider, with no authority to enter into contracts, agreements, make warranties, or create obligations on our behalf, or bind us to any express or implied commitments.

As an autonomous business entity, you will maintain control, management, and daily operations of the Franchise Outlet, including determining prices for approved products and services, hiring and terminating staff, and setting their wages and benefits. It is acknowledged that we hold no responsibility or liability regarding your pricing decisions, staffing matters, or wage structures.

All quality and performance standards, as outlined in Paragraph XII, are designed to uphold and preserve the value of the Brands and System, ensuring optimal control over product and service quality. You shall be solely accountable for the preparation and quality of food at the Franchise Outlet.

In the event that any third party is misled into believing you have authority to act on our behalf, we assume no responsibility or liability for such misunderstandings.

original: XXIII. MISCELLANEOUS A.   Our failure to exercise any power reserved to us hereunder, or to insist upon strict compliance by you with any obligation or condition hereunder, and any custom or practice of the parties in variance with the terms hereof, shall not constitute a waiver of our right to demand exact compliance with the terms hereof.  Our waiver of any default by you shall not be binding unless in writing and executed by us and shall not affect or impair our right with respect to any subsequent default of the same or of a different nature.
ollama_generated: XXIII. MISCELLANEOUS A. Exercising powers reserved to us under this agreement, or choosing not to enforce strict compliance by you with any obligations or conditions herein, and adhering to any custom or practice between the parties that may differ from the terms set forth in this agreement, does not imply a waiver of our right to insist on strict adherence to these terms. A waiver of your breach must be explicitly stated in writing, signed by us, and shall not affect or lessen our ability to enforce subsequent breaches of a similar or different nature.

original: 1919 Interchange Tower 600 South Highway 169 Minneapolis, Minnesota 55426 Copy to           Mary Beth Brody, Esq.
ollama_generated:
1919 Interchange Tower 600 South Highway 169, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55426
Recipient: Mary Beth Brody, Esq.

In the event of any dispute arising out of this agreement:

A. The Parties shall first engage in good faith negotiations to resolve such disputes amicably;
B. If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days of notification of the dispute, either Party may commence arbitration proceedings, with the venue being Minneapolis, Minnesota, and governed by the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
C. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, subject to judicial review for manifest disregard of the law or other extraordinary circumstances.
D. Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other from any costs, damages, or expenses, including reasonable attorney's fees, arising out of or in connection with such arbitration.
E. In the event that either Party initiates a lawsuit related to this agreement before engaging in required negotiations or commencing arbitration as provided herein, the non-initiating Party may move to dismiss or stay the action on the grounds set forth above.

original: E.   Each Paragraph, part, term and/or provision of this Agreement shall be considered severable, and if, for any reason, any Paragraph, part, term and/or provision herein is determined to be invalid and contrary to, or in conflict with any existing or future law or regulation, such shall not impair the operation of or affect the remaining portions, sections, parts, terms and/or provisions of this Agreement, and the latter will continue to be given full force and effect and bind the parties hereto; and said invalid sections, parts, terms and/or provisions shall be reformed to most nearly implement the intentions of the parties hereto or, if reformation is not possible, be deemed not part of this Agreement; provided, however, that if we determine that said finding of illegality adversely affects the basic consideration of this Agreement, we may, at our option, terminate this Agreement.  Anything to the contrary herein notwithstanding, nothing in this Agreement is intended, nor shall be deemed, to confer upon any person or legal entity other than you and us and such of their respective successors and assigns as may be contemplated by this Agreement, any rights or remedies under or by reason of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: F. Each provision, paragraph, term, or condition within this Agreement is deemed independent, such that if, for any reason, a court deems any provision to be unenforceable, illegal, or in conflict with an existing or future law or regulation, it shall not invalidate the remaining provisions of this Agreement. Instead, the affected provision will be construed, to the extent possible, to reflect the original intent of the parties. If construction is impossible, the invalidated provision shall be considered null and void but will have no impact on the enforceability or validity of the remaining provisions. It is explicitly understood that if we determine this finding significantly alters the fundamental nature of our agreement, either party may opt to terminate this Agreement. However, it is clarified that nothing in this Agreement confers any rights, remedies, or obligations upon any third party except for you and us, as well as any future successors or assigns authorized under this Agreement.

original: B.   ANY ACTION SOUGHT TO BE BROUGHT BY EITHER PARTY OR ANY ACTION BROUGHT BY YOU AGAINST OUR PARENT OR OTHER AFFILIATE, SHALL BE BROUGHT IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT OR THE STATE DISTRICT COURT IN THE STATE IN WHICH OUR COMPANY HEADQUARTERS ARE LOCATED.  AS OF THE DATE OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE LOCATION IS HENNEPIN COUNTY, MINNESOTA.  THE PARTIES DO HEREBY WAIVE ALL QUESTIONS OF PERSONAL JURISDICTION OR VENUE FOR THE PURPOSES OF CARRYING OUT THIS PROVISION.
ollama_generated: A. In the event that either Party initiates any legal action, or you file a lawsuit against our Parent Company or any of its Affiliates, such action must be instituted in the United States District Court or the State District Court situated within the state where our Corporation's Headquarters are currently located. As of the effective date of this Agreement, that location is Hennepin County, Minnesota. The Parties hereby mutually waive any objections to personal jurisdiction and venue with regard to enforcing this provision. However, it is understood that either Party retains the right to challenge jurisdiction or venue at the earliest possible stage in the proceedings, should they deem such a challenge necessary.

original: B.   The party seeking to initiate the procedure shall give written notice to the other party, describing in general terms the nature of the dispute, the claim for relief and identifying one or more individuals with authority to settle the dispute on such party's behalf.  The party receiving such notice shall have ten (10) business days within which to designate by written notice one or more individuals with authority to settle the dispute on such party's behalf.
modified: A. The recipient of this notification, who may be contemplating a disagreement, is obligated to provide written communication detailing their concerns in a general sense, outlining any requested remedy and specifying individuals empowered to negotiate a resolution on their behalf. The initiator of the procedure shall receive such designation within ten (10) business days, during which time they are not bound to take any action unless otherwise specified.

original: E.   In consultation with the mediator selected, the parties shall promptly designate a mutually convenient time and place for the mediation, and unless circumstances require otherwise, such time is to be not later than forty-five (45) days after selection of the mediator.  In the event any party to this Agreement has substantial need for information in the possession of another party to this Agreement in order to prepare for the mediation, all parties shall attempt in good faith to agree on procedures for the expeditious exchange of such information, with the help of the mediator if required.  At least seven (7) days prior to the first scheduled session of the mediation, each party shall deliver to the mediator and to the other party a concise written summary of its views on the matter in dispute, and such other matters required by the mediator.
ollama_generated: F. The parties, in consultation with the designated mediator, shall collaboratively determine a mutually suitable time and location for the mediation proceedings. However, the mediator may initiate the process if neither party responds within a reasonable timeframe, at which point the mediation will commence within sixty (60) days of the mediator's initiation. In cases where one party requires significant information from another to prepare for the mediation, they shall make a good faith effort to negotiate an efficient information exchange process. The mediator may facilitate this process if necessary. At least ten (10) business days prior to the initial mediation session, each party is expected to submit to the mediator and the other party a succinct written statement outlining their perspective on the disputed matter, as well as any additional information required by the mediator for effective mediation.

original: XXVI.  OWNER AGREEMENT The franchisee ("you") includes all persons who succeed to the interest of the original franchisee by permitted transfer or operation of law and shall be deemed to include not only the individual or entity described in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement but shall also include all partners if you are a partnership, all shareholders if you are a corporation and all members if you are a limited liability company.  By their signatures hereto, all of your officers, partners, members and managers acknowledge and accept the duties and obligations imposed upon each of them, individually, by the terms of this Agreement.  All partners, all shareholders, or all members, as the case may be, and your restaurant manager must execute the Owner Agreement attached as EXHIBIT A and made a part hereof.
ollama_generated:
XXXVI. BINDING COMMITMENTS OF THE FRANCHISEE

The party acquiring the franchise (hereinafter "you") may consist of individuals who inherit the initial franchisee's rights through approved transfers or legal succession. Such parties are considered as part of the original franchisee for the purposes of this Agreement, extending to include not only the individual or entity initially named in this document but also any partners if you are a partnership, shareholders if you are a corporation, and members if you are a limited liability company.

By signing below, each of your officers, partners, members, managers, and key personnel (as defined by your business structure) acknowledges and accepts the responsibilities and obligations enforced upon them individually, in accordance with this Agreement's terms. However, it is not required for all individual partners, shareholders, or members, as well as the restaurant manager, to sign the Owner Agreement found in EXHIBIT A. Instead, only one representative from your organization should execute the agreement on behalf of all parties involved. This singular signature binds each member of your team to the terms of this Agreement.

original: B.   You acknowledge that other of our franchisees have been or will be granted franchises at different times and in different situations, and further acknowledges that the provisions of such franchises may vary substantially from those contained in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: A. You acknowledge and understand that this Franchise Agreement is unique to your specific circumstances, and you are aware that other franchisees were or will be granted franchises with variations different from the provisions outlined in this Agreement, at various times and under diverse situations.

original: E.   It is contemplated that the parties may execute this Agreement on different dates.  The date of execution and the commencement of the term of this Agreement shall take place on the date this Agreement is executed by us.
ollama_generated: F. Hereby acknowledged, it's possible for the parties to sign this Agreement separately at distinct times. However, the effective date of this Agreement's duration will commence upon our mutual execution of the Agreement. This means that although we may sign on different days, the Agreement shall be considered binding only from the date all parties have signed.

original: ATTEST:                             BW-3 FRANCHISE SYSTEMS, INC.
modified:
AFFIRMATION:              FRANCHISE SYSTEMS, INC., AS BW-3

This subtle change in the title from "Attest" to "Affirmation" signifies a shift in the tone and intent of the statement. "Attest" implies a solemn declaration or assertion made by one party with the expectation that it is true, while "Affirmation" carries a less formal connotation, suggesting an expression of agreement or confirmation rather than a pledge of truth. This change weakens the obligation slightly as it may be perceived as a more casual commitment from the party making the statement.

original: - ------------------------------        ------------------------------------------ Witness ---------------------------------------- EXHIBIT A BUFFALO WILD WINGS OWNER AGREEMENT As a condition to the granting by bw-3 Franchise Systems, Inc. ("we" or "us") of an Area Development Agreement and/or one or more Franchise Agreements executed (collectively the "Agreements") providing certain rights relating to Buffalo Wild Wings Restaurants (the "Restaurants") to ________________________ ________________ ("Franchisee"), each of the undersigned individuals ("you"), who constitute each beneficial holder of an interest in the Franchisee, covenants and agrees to be bound by the terms and restrictions of this Agreement ("Agreement"):
ollama_generated:
Clause:
------------------------------        ------------------------------------------ Witness ---------------------------------------- EXHIBIT A BUFFALO WILD WINGS OWNER AGREEMENT

As a consideration for us, bw-3 Franchise Systems, Inc. ("we" or "us"), granting certain rights relating to Buffalo Wild Wings Restaurants (the "Restaurants") to ________________________ ________________ ("Franchisee"), we, each of the undersigned individuals ("you"), who constitute each beneficial holder of an interest in the Franchisee, covenant and agree to be bound by the terms and restrictions of this Agreement ("Agreement"), recognizing that our obligations under this Agreement are contingent upon your fulfillment of all your obligations under the same.

This modification subtly shifts the initial obligation from the company (bw-3 Franchise Systems, Inc.) to the Franchisee. In other words, the company's obligations are now dependent on the Franchisee's fulfillment of their own obligations. This could be seen as a form of reciprocity or mutual agreement in the contractual relationship.

original: A.    IN TERM COVENANT NOT-TO-COMPETE.  Each of you agrees that during the period Franchisee operates any Buffalo Wild Wings and/or bw-3 Restaurants, or has any beneficial interest therein, or holds any rights to develop one or more such Restaurants (including all renewal periods) you shall not directly or indirectly on your own account or as an employee, consultant, partner, officer, director, shareholder or member of any person, firm, entity, partnership, corporation or company, own, operate, lease franchise, engage in, be connected with, have any interest in, or assist any person or entity engaged in:  1) any restaurant business, 2) any prepared food business, or 3) any other business which sells prepared food products the same or similar as the type sold in our System.
ollama_generated:
B. CONSIDERED NON-COMPETITION PROVISION. In mutual agreement, you warrant that throughout the duration of your franchise operation for any Buffalo Wild Wings and/or bw-3 Restaurants, or during any period in which you retain a beneficial interest, rights to develop, or rights to renew these restaurants, you shall refrain from:

1. Directly or indirectly, personally or professionally, as an independent contractor, principal, agent, or shareholder, owning, operating, leasing a franchise, managing, or otherwise being involved in any capacity with:
   a) a restaurant business
   b) a prepared food business
   c) any enterprise that sells prepared food items substantially similar to those offered within our System. However, this restriction shall not extend to investments in publicly traded securities of companies whose primary line of business is not competitive with the system.

In other words, while operating under the franchise agreement and during the renewal periods, you are prohibited from engaging in any businesses that directly compete with ours. This does not include passive investments in non-competing companies through publicly traded securities.

original: B.    POST TERM COVENANT NOT-TO-COMPETE.  Each of you agrees that for a two-year period after Franchisee ceases to have any interest in any Restaurants or any rights to develop Restaurants, regardless of the reasons such interest ceases or terminates, you will not directly or indirectly on your own account or as an employee, consultant, partner, officer, director, shareholder or member of any person, firm, entity, partnership, corporation or company, own operate, lease franchise, engage in, be connected with, have any interest in, or assist any person or entity engaged in:  1) any restaurant business, 2) any prepared food business, or 3) any other business which sells prepared food products the same or similar as the type sold in our System; which is located at or within a ten (10) mile radius of your former Franchised Restaurant or any Buffalo Wild Wings or bw-3 Restaurant.
ollama_generated:
C. MODIFIED RESTRICTIVE COVENANT REGARDING POST-TERMINATION ACTIVITIES. Upon cessation of any involvement with the Franchisee and its Restaurants, for a period of two years thereafter, each party acknowledges and agrees that they shall not:

1) Directly or indirectly, on their own behalf or as an employee, advisor, stakeholder, or member of any entity, partnership, corporation, or company, engage in or be associated with the ownership, operation, leasing, franchising, management, or any other interest in a restaurant business, prepared food business, or any enterprise selling ready-made food products substantially similar to those offered within our System. This restriction applies regardless of the reason for termination or cease of involvement.
2) During this same period, establish, invest in, or support any such businesses within a ten (10) mile radius of their former Franchisee Restaurant, or any current Buffalo Wild Wings or bw-3 Restaurant locations.

This provision is intended to balance the interests of both parties while minimizing potential conflicts and competition during the post-termination phase.

original: E.    SOLICITATION OF EMPLOYEES. Any breach of this provision shall be deemed a material breach of this agreement.
